item.title: Visualizing Movie Dialog with ggplot2
item.description: Some intro text. characters <- read.delim("~/Documents/website/movie-dialog/movie-dialog-corpus/movie_characters_metadata.tsv",header=FALSE) names(characters) <- c("charID","charName","movID","movTitle","gender","creditPosition") head(characters) ## charID charName movID movTitle gender creditPosition ## 1 u0 BIANCA m0 10 things i hate about you f 4 ## 2 u1 BRUCE m0 10 things i hate about you ? ? ## 3 u2 CAMERON m0 10 things i hate about you m 3 ## 4 u3 CHASTITY m0 10 things i hate about you ? ? ## 5 u4 JOEY m0 10 things i hate about you m 6 ## 6 u5 KAT m0 10 things i hate about you f 2

item.title: Setting Up This Site
item.description: To kick things off, I want to share some details about how I created this site in case theyâ€™re helpful for anyone else in the future. I landed on the GitHub/Hugo/blogdown workflow after some Google searching and went with it for a few reasons: I already had a GitHub account and wanted to get more practice using git, and take advantage of the free hosting options there. Amber Thomas provides a walkthrough of setting up a Hugo site using blogdown, and she made it look pretty simple.
